['Here are some examples of literary extracts that could be included in an anthology:', '"The Love Song of J', '"The Road Not Taken" by Robert Frost - This famous poem explores the idea of choice and regret, as the speaker considers the path not taken in life.', '"The Yellow Wallpaper" by Charlotte Perkins Gilman - This short story is a powerful critique of the patriarchal society and the oppression of women, as seen through the eyes of a woman confined to a room by her husband.', '"The Great Gatsby" by F', '"The Metamorphosis" by Franz Kafka - This novella tells the story of a man who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect, and explores themes of identity, alienation, and the absurd.', '"The Catcher in the Rye" by J.D', '"The Handmaid\'s Tale" by Margaret Atwood - Set in a dystopian future, this novel explores themes of oppression, resistance, and the role of women in society, as seen through the eyes of Offred, a handmaid in a totalitarian regime.', '"The Picture of Dorian Gray" by Oscar Wilde - This novel explores the idea of youth and beauty, as well as the corrupting influence of desire and the superficiality of society, through the character of Dorian Gray.', '"Heart of Darkness" by Joseph Conrad - This novella follows the story of Marlow as he travels into the heart of Africa and grapples with the darkness of human nature and the corrupting influence of power.', '"The Bell Jar" by Sylvia Plath - This semi-autobiographical novel explores themes of mental illness, identity, and the oppression of women, as seen through the eyes of Esther Greenwood.', "The specific extracts chosen would depend on the focus and theme of the anthology, as well as the author's personal preferences."]
